page.title: 10Croxteth - A Poem
page.content: If you remember in 1952 (And hundreds of people do) The foundations were laid, And people were paid, And the Croxteth Estate was built. Now lots of problems have slowly arisen, Unemployment and drugs galore The foundations were laid, And people were paid, But Croxteth began to wilt. The once proud houses have been demolished, Some stand naked and bare on the streets. People hang homeless around, Is nobody here aware ? The Croxteth problems are getting worse, Nothing is quite the same. People are asked where they are from, 'Croxteth' is said in shame. (cont.)
